py_sim.launch.grid_planning module¶

grid_planning.py: Provides a framework for visualization of planning using an occupancy grid

Basic graph search techniques are implemented, including:

  • Breadth-first

  • Depth-first

  • Dijkstra

  • A*

  • Greedy

class py_sim.launch.grid_planning.GridPlanning(initial_state: UnicycleStateType, n_inputs: int, plots: PlotManifest[UnicycleStateType], world: PolygonWorld, planner: ForwardGridSearch)¶

Bases: Generic[UnicycleStateType], SingleAgentSim[UnicycleStateType]

Framework for implementing a simulator that just tests out a feedback controller

world¶

World in which the planning occurs

Type:

PolygonWorld

planner¶

The planner that is used for planning

Type:

ForwardGridSearch

plan_update(plan_steps: int = -1) → bool¶
Makes a single update to the plan. Returns true if the planner

has popped the goal off of the planning queue

Parameters:

plan_steps – The number of planning steps to take

post_process() → None¶

Process the results

update() → None¶

Does nothing - no movement of vehicle

py_sim.launch.grid_planning.test_grid_planner() → None¶

Plans a path using a grid-based approach

Grid path planning done in the following steps:

  • Create a world

  • Create a planner

  • Create the plotting

  • Incrementally calculate the plan until plan calculated

  • Calculate the plan length

Python Planning Sim
